title.narrative: PEACEBUILDING AND SOCIAL COHESION

description.narrative: Output 3.4 Local authorities and adolescents in selected locations have improved capacities to ensure social cohesion, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, disadvantaged children and their families utilise equitable access to justice and social services to prevent and respond to violence, discrimination and family separation

related-activity.ref: 2450/A0/06/003 OUTCOME 3. PROTECTION FROM VIOLENCE, DISCRIMINATION AND CONFLICT PREVENTION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.4 Local authorities and adolescents in selected locations have improved capacities to ensure social cohesion

description.narrative: The government committed to continue the Youth and Child Friendly Cities contest, which supports the participation of young people in decision-making at municipal level. Adolescent and youth participation was strengthened with the launch of U-Report, with over7,000U-Reporters in the country by the end December. A total of 989 girls were trained in life skills, which they in turn cascaded to 12,851 boys and girls. A further 2,812 people participated in community dialogues on discriminatory social and gender norms. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022

target.value: 2022:Existence of functional local level mechanisms for participation of adolescents especially the most disadvantaged

actual.value: 2020:Unions of School parliaments in 10 rural municipalities and Youth Consultative Councils are in place in 18 urban municipalities

title.narrative: Existence of functional national and sub-national mechanisms for participation of adolescents especially the most disadvantaged, Text

target.value: 2022:Youth participation training and guidance for youth councils and LSGs revised/upgraded and roll out supported in 7 LSGs

actual.value: 2021:16 towns have established youth councils which support the municipality in participatory yearly planning
